reviews.text: Nice pub with friendly staff and good food üòäüëå
What a great find on our way to the Intrepid Museum. Highly recommend the fish and chips and the shepherds pie! Plus got to watch some football. Excellent service!
Bangers and mash...
Good quick service and great conversation and they had live Irish music when I went which contributed to the great atmosphere
Irish pub serving relatively traditional Irish fare. Oddly enough they were out of Guinness when I went.
Best fish & chips in the city
Service rapide et de bonne qualit√©
Donnacha and crew are all about Irish experience
Great food, friendly wait staff.  Got off the circle tour and walked up the street. Food was great, price was great.  Had a good kids menu.
Cozy pub with amazing food. We had the Bangers and Mash, Corned Beef, and the Chicken Rollantini. Everything was soooo good.

Best food I‚Äôve had in a while. Service was a
Perfect!
Sehr gem√ºtlich

What a great bar/restaurant. The Landmark has been open since 1868 and Andrew Johnson ( President) was one of the first guests. The building has the original wooden bar, tile, glass and ceiling.
The bartender is a friendly man who explained the history of the restaurant and the history of the picture of the ship üö¢ hanging near the bar.
Although we didn‚Äôt order food, everything we saw being delivered looked delicious. We entered around noon and the restaurant was quite busy. We sat at the bar and enjoyed the history.
It‚Äôs a great place to have a drink.ü•É ( and food)
This spot is hands down the best in the area. Michael, the owner, is an incredible host‚Äîwelcoming, accommodating, and film-friendly. The place has such a unique charm the moment you walk in.

We had a fantastic time here. Pete was our server and was  great. He was helpful on what to do, And where to go to accomplish our goal while visiting the city.  Would not have a problem coming back here to eat.  Thanks for the great experience while visiting the city.
Top stuff
Seems to be an old restaurant but service is good Employees are fast and reliable

We visited The Landmark Tavern on 11th Avenue. The steak was flavorful and well prepared, and the beer ‚Äì especially the dark Guinness ‚Äì was excellent. The burger, on the other hand, was nothing remarkable. The fried chicken fingers were decent, but very simple, and the fries came overcooked. What really disappointed me was the side dish: the menu listed ‚Äústeamed vegetables,‚Äù which normally suggests peppers, tomatoes, corn, or maybe eggplant. Instead, I was served a full plate of broccoli. Since I cannot tolerate broccoli, this should have been clarified on the menu. A more accurate name would be Steak with mashed potatoes and broccoli.
Sheppards pie is amazing, service is incredible, atmosphere is awesome. Great spot for beer and lunch.

Abe was our server. He was extremely attentive,  professional and gave great communication!! It was across the street from our hotel.So conveniently located.. my husband absolutely loved the vintage look of it. Our food was okay... but our service and communication from abe was extraordinary!!! He was so personable... we went back in for a drink after our day touring new york city and to our surprise, abe was the server again.And we were just as pleasantly pleased as we were the first visit!
New York vibe. Shepherds pie and chicken wrap good
Loved this historic gem.
Very nice place

I can‚Äôt say enough good things about this place.  The food is really good and what sets this place apart is the service.  I was looking for apartments in the area and took my elderly mom to get lunch here and she asks me everyday if I‚Äôve been back yet.

A great dinner at Landmark Tavern  in Hell‚Äôs Kitchen.

Opened in 1868, it is one of the oldest continuously operating bars in NYC.

Back in the day, it was literally waterfront property - there was no 12th Avenue until the 1880‚Äôs when it was created with landfill.

We had the corner beef & cabbage and braised lamb shank - both were delicious.
Il miglior fish and chips che abbia mangiato, buona musica di sottofondo e personale cortese. Consigliatissimo.
A bit cold from the A/C, but my kids were not. Go on a Monday for really fun fun live Irish folk music.
Non male la cucina, servizio cortese, bagni puliti, prezzi ragionevoli (per le follie di NY)
Trop cool pour l ambiance et la cuisine
Wonderful historical tavern.  Great atmosphere.

I don't give many 5 stars but The Landmark Tavern gets it. The atmosphere is amazinging and the owner spent some time with us just talking.  I loved it. A local Tavern with more than just bar food.  Don't miss this place!

The best leek and potato soup I have ever eaten in my entire life we came back 4 times for the soups it was AMAZING . The waiter PIS AND LUI he was super nice and polite . I‚Äôm coming back to the USA for that soup !!!

I had an absolute amazing experience. I came here to celebrate my birthday and my server Archie was very engaging,funny, witty, and helpful with the menu. He allowed me to know all of the different specials and gave suggestions according to our preferences. You made me feel special on my day. I can't wait to come back. Thanks Archie. üòÇ

Loved this old tavern!  The drinks are good, the bartenders are very personable, the food is good, the bar is beautiful. First trip to NYC, stumbled on this place and went back twice. Can‚Äôt wait for another trip!
Great spot! I got shepherds pie, fries, and shrimp salad and was not disappointed! Good service and presentation. I'm not much of a drinker but I can at least vouch for the food here.
This is a bucket place bar and restaurant.

Foods service and atmosphere were all great! The waitress and the bartender were super friendly and attentive; my hamburger (sirloin and Swiss cheese) was delicious as well as the French fries! I also had an Aperol spritz which was also very good. The place is very clean and there are tables suitable for all size of groups.
Pas tr√®s moin du mus√©e de l'intr√©pide, une tr√®s bonne adresse. Les plats sont succulents et le service impeccable
It felt like going back in time. Great service and good food.

The decor is vintage NY saloon. Lots of wood. Comfortable seats at the bar. The type of place that regulars have frequented for years. We settled in for some draft beers. We followed that with a burger & fries + fish & chips. Food & beer were solid & satisfying.

Service from behind the bar was first rate (well, he is Canadian). He was polished, entertaining & took care of our needs.

Fellow patrons are very friendly (they bought us drinks). It's a very convivial place.
WC nebolo ƒçist√©.

This is our second visit to this place, we first stumbled across it in 2020 after visiting the USS Intrepid. We returned this time around as the food and service are excellent and I feel it is good value for money (the corned beef sandwich is amazing!). The place has that lovely, old-fashioned personal touch and would highly recommend it to all groups, there is a kids' menu and it is wheelchair user-friendly.
I heard a rumour, one of the best burgers, well me tell you - delivers. Recommend - even to a friend.
Historic location only, just a bar now.
Bartenders are great. Especially Abe!
Do yourself a favor and order the deviled eggs and cauliflower pizza.
Wow this Ahi salad was amazing! Fresh fish daily.

Historic pub since 1868, Landmark Tavern is a really affordable and convenient dining option for Javits Center conference goers.

My friend and I sat by the bar counter and [imo] got some of the most genuine and gentle service from Mr. Bartender..

Fish and chips were crispy and steamy, and the Guinness was smooth -- all for under $30 in 2025.
Comfortable,  friendly atmosphere in an uncomfortable unfriendly world.
Terrific traditional Irish bar, great stock of whiskies and obviously a first class pint of the black stuff

I stopped in today while I was in the area since I had this restaurant on my radar for a while, and I love visiting places that have a long history. I was greeted and served by Pratap, and he was very welcoming, friendly, and attentive. I ordered the Corned Beef and Cabbage, and it was very good. The Corned Beef was really the star of the dish as it was cooked perfectly and just melted in my mouth. The menu isn't too large, but it looks like the portions are very generous for the prices. I absolutely loved the atmosphere of this place where it gives off a classic pub look. I definitely recommend it as this is one of those places that is great for a quick bite, a date night, or just grab a couple of drinks.

I had the Shepard's Pie at lunch. Putting aside the issue of the flavor of it, there was literally no chunks of meat in it. The only flavor came from the meat sauce, which had some tiny pieces of meat in it. Previous review mentions about the age of the restaurant led me to believe it would be apparent immediately upon entry, it was not.

I have been semi regularly coming to landmark for almost two years and on Monday‚Äôs.

The classic decor on the outside and from when you walk in the bar, you feel as if you stepped back in time to the late 1800‚Äôs when this bar was first established.

The dark decor give it a grimy but cool layout, Mondays, they usually have a band in the back playing Irish music.

Though this place is a bar, they have some solid food options. I usually get the fish & chips and to be honest, it‚Äôs amongst the best in the city. So much flavor and with a side of salad to keep it extra flavorful.
The bangers and mash are also a bar classic if you‚Äôre more on the heavy side of a meal.

I am not a big beer drinker; however, when I go to Landmark, I must always get the ‚ÄúLandmark Ale‚Äù. It‚Äôs a perfect light side beer and just hits well after one of their classic meals.

Peter has been there for quite some time and usually looks out with a round on the house before I leave at the end of the night.

If you want to feel as if you‚Äôre stepping back in time, not be bothered and just enjoy a beer while watching a game? Head to Landmark.
The draft beers, fish and chips do not disappoint and more importantly, it‚Äôs a price of NYC as well as Hell‚Äôs Kitchen history.
Comfort food at its finest! A great spot for real Irish food ü•ò I personally loved Shepherds pie ü•ß

Two in our party have celiac disease so we have to eat strictly gluten free which I wasn‚Äôt expecting to find at a tavern. Our pleasant server recommended the fresh grilled fish. We had fresh grilled halibut, mashed potatoes, and steamed veggies. It was amazing! We will be back!

Personally this was the best food I‚Äôve ever had not just in New York but in the whole US. Before this the best I‚Äôd ever tasted was the Dungeness crab sandwich at Ettas in Seattle. But Landmark Tavern has finally surpassed that.

Every dish was delicious but the shepards pie was truly the best meal of my life. On top of that everyone at the restaurant was incredibly kind and attentive.

I‚Äôm grateful for the month I spent here. Thank you to everyone.

Outstanding fish and chips and guinness. Service could have been a bit more efficient, especially since the place was kind of empty when I was there, but small gripe. This is a great place, order the fish and chips and get a guinness, it will not disappoint!

Muito bom ! Cerveja Guinness √≥tima, pedimos lanches e as por√ß√µes eram muito bem servidas, apenas as batatas estavam um pouco gordurosas,  mas isso n√£o tira a boa avalia√ß√£o do local.
Gostei e indico.
It wasn‚Äôt busy but it took over an hour to get our food. We wanted pub food but this food was very mediocre. And it wasn‚Äôt cheap. Wish we had just stopped for a quick slice of pizza instead.

We had an amazing experience finding this little gem while waiting on our Circle Line cruise.  We got the Fish and Chips and it is easily one of my favorites I've ever had.   The service was exceptional and the vibe in the little pub is amazing.   So glad we found this little place.
So good we went twice in one day! Great host, great food, beautiful pint of Guinness.
Great food, came out quick and bartender was excellent. We tried sitting in the dining area but the wait was very long for service which is why we sat at the bar. Great for after the Intrepid visit.

Impressive Irish bar in Manhattan
Old fashion decoration with lovely landmark beer
Bella scoperta. Tipico pub irlandese, a due passi dal museo della portaerei Intrepid. Piatti gustosi, ottima scelta di birre irlandesi, tra cui la famosa Guinness. Servizio veloce. Consigliato.

Tr√®s bonne taverne !! On y mange bien
2 pintes et 2 bergers pour une cinquantaine de dollars. Le cadre est tr√®s beau.

The food was fanatic here!! We had bangers and mash and a Long Island duck meal. 12/10 recommend! Also, had the Scottish eggs as an appetizer! Food was hot and delicious! Bartender was super friendly as well.

Visiting from Florida, and was recommended to come here.
Very cool old spot with a lot of history. Ordered fish and chips, it was OK, have had much better. The fish pieces were thin and not very big. Fries were good. Did not come with coleslaw(tasty), had to order on the side. Also got the caesar salad with grilled chicken(dry and tough), the dressing was a little too tangy for me. They could also have more beer choices on tap. Server was very nice and attentive.

The service was super friendly start to finish. Decor was legit old Irish pub as billed. The food was really variable. Shepherd‚Äôs Pie was the best I‚Äôve ever had. Salmon Caesar was uninspired. Salads were ok. Kids burger was just that. I‚Äôd return to drink with friends.

Very welcoming ambiance and staff. Food was great, reasonable prices. I only had lunch, and I still want to come back a Monday evening for the Irish music live.
First time I was there, I had the Irish bangers and mash; second time, the sirloin wrap. Big portions, only could eat all of it because both tasted sooo good!

Incredible, absolutely Incredible.
They have a great selection of draught beers, soups, and some of the best shepherds pie I've ever had.
The place is cozy, warm, and a little away from the downtown busy-ness.
9.5/10, I wish I had a bigger stomach!

My husband and I were craving great food after the air craft museum.
And we accidentally found this place.

Nice atmosphere, and nice service.
Good was so great!
Not too much oil, or salty, just perfect!
And in NY, this is important.
Not too pricey.
It is fair price.

You can enjoy this place.

Irlandzka tawerna
Jedzenie dobre
Kaczka dobrze przysmazona z ry≈ºem
Spring Rolls
Na deser new york cheese cake
Oblsuga bardzo UprzejmƒÖ
Klimat typowy irlandzki lokal
Warto tu zajrzeƒá
Bon restaurant irlandais avec de bonnes bi√®res ; le service est sympa et la cuisine n‚Äôest pas grasse. Le rapport qualit√© prix est correct

FABULOUS food, great service.

*update 2 years later*

We returned to NYC, and I knew we had to make a trip to the Landmark again. My husband had the same steak and it was just as amazing as our last visit.

Highly recommend the steak here.

I had the lamb shank, as I don't recall ever having lamb before. It was tasty. The bloody mart was spicy and the Long Island Ice tea was good (but a bit pricier than I would have guessed).

Friendly staff and prompt service. We will be back on our next NYC trip.

The interior of this restaurant is gorgeous, the waitstaff are so attentive and sweet! Cozy ambiance, quiet at the time we went (around 4PM on a Sunday) we had the lands end lager, which was a draft, tastes very similar to Stella. The grilled sirloin was perfect, the bordelaise sauce went so well with the mashed potatoes. My friend
went for the landmark burger, it had cheese, mushrooms, and onions. The French fries were skin on, so that was a nice surprise. The nutty Irishman coffee was smooth, sweet liqueur, baileys and topped with sweet cream. Would come back again!

There are a lot of crappy Irish bars in Manhattan. HOWEVER, Landmark Tavern stands out as a GREAT old bar. Irish in the sense of welcoming. Beautiful wood bar and excellent food. The staff are so friendly and helpful, that you feel like a regular the first time you come. There are so many bad bars as you walk towards the Theater District, but go further West and feel like you're slipping into a neighborhood tradition.

First time here and it was lovely! Great seating outside and service had a local feel. Food was also DELICIOUS. Pictures are the lobster ravioli, shepherds pie, and chocolate cake. Social distancing measures were also perfect. Will definitely be coming back regularly!

Awesome suggestion from our circle Cruise line guide to try this place. So we did. Great Irish pub with the original bar still there! The service was great and the food was fantastic. Try the wings! And the roasted duck or fish and chips.
Class place. Very local. Service could take it up a bit. Not bad service just slow. Food came to the table fast. Big portions.
